File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_BrokenMoonlantern.lsj
Synopsis:
Player finds a broken Moonlantern while looting Nere's body. Companions reflect on it - either unsure what it is or discussing the fact that it's a Moonlantern, which would help them traverse a cursed land. If it wasn't broken.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_ArguingGnomes.lsj
Synopsis:
Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is. This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

uid: 01fd8fe3-12aa-4613-82af-a44b6b2969fd
Node context: Pleading for her friend not to tell.
> That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.
> Leave the True Soul to me. Now tell me what you know.
> A terrible situation. I'm sure you'll pay handsomely if I help.
> You have nothing to fear when Lunkbug is such a loyal friend. Let me help. If Nere does anything to you, I will reply in kind. Tell me what you know. I will free you from the yoke of Nere. Tell me what you know. Fear not, sister. You are under my protection. Tell me what you know. Fear not, gnome. I will protect you. Tell me what you know.
> To protect the innocent is my call. Trust me. I won't fail you.

Synopsis:
The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.

Synopsis:
Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_DeepHole.lsj
Synopsis:
A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed. First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

0:0 - Leave.
uid: 114220dd-8364-f075-ce60-c28ce1a1301f

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_DuergarCamp_Checkpoint.lsj
Synopsis:
After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment. there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.

Synopsis:
Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny). Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_DuergarCamp_RebelGreedyExtort.lsj
Synopsis:
In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.

0:0 - Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.
uid: 01c4813b-b93e-71be-0209-1f7e12bd653f
> Please. We catch your scent, and you'll get sliced 'fore you can bat your left eye.

0:0 - Your brain going mushy, jargh? That's where those Absolute-freaks hole up.
uid: 0df357f6-4972-4832-2986-f23959eee4e2

Synopsis:
This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric. Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_DuergarLoyalSergeant.lsj
Synopsis:
The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_ElevatorGuard_001.lsj
Synopsis:
One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

0:0 - *'Worst. Hangover. Ever.', Geddarm concluded.*
uid: 0776b864-f077-7ad9-b8d5-7a90f1457b41
> null

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_FearfulRothe_Rothe_001.lsj
Synopsis:
Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.

Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).

Synopsis:
Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird. -------- When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_KuoToaGod_PAD_MagicGone.lsj
Synopsis:
This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.

0:0 - His power died with the fish creatures. I expected more from the 'Lord of Murder'.
1:0 - Quite a bit less-than-divine for a god, wasn't he? With powers as fleeting as his followers' lives.

2:0 - Poor old BOOOAL, wasn't long for this world after all.
3:0 - The power has dispersed. He was no god - hardly even an imitation.
4:0 - Seems like his godlike powers died with his followers.
5:0 - So much for the 'Lord of Murder'. Pretty fishy, if you ask me.
6:0 - Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_KuoToaGod_SpeakWithBOOOAL.lsj
Synopsis:
The player encounters a group of kuo-toa, humanoid fish beings capable of creating gods just by imagining them. They're overzealous and easily duped, and are currently worshipping a murderous redcap they've mistaken for a god of murder. He's capitalising on the situation and very much enjoying the incredible power with which he's been invested. In this dialogue, we can deal with him as this great inscrutable power, or see through the situation and expose / do a deal with him. In all cases he's brash, offensive and generally gross. The all cap lines are BOOOAL in his fully powerful form. When we suddenly rever to lower caps, it's when we've forced him into his 'common' form. BOOOAL = Boo-AHHL (almost guttural) Kuo-Toa = Koo-oh-TO-ah

Node context: Dismissive of our stories, wants to get straight to killing - calling to his priest to attack us
> null

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_LoneDuergar.lsj
Synopsis:
A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MonkAmulet_AD_FailedWisdomSave.lsj
Synopsis:
After resting and leaving camp, the haunted amulet curses the player with periodic fits of laughter if they use the amulet's ability if they do not pass a wisdom save. Amulet speaks this dialogue. Shar-allied clerics and paladins get different lines: the amulet is happy to drive them mad.

0:0 - Ha-ha, hath thy mind been truly lost?
0:1 - This is no time for such spectacle.
0:2 - Hee! Please do get a hold of thineself.
1:0 - Mine humblest apologies. Ha ha ha.
1:1 - Ha - I share in thy pain.
1:2 - Would that I might ease thy madness.
uid: 0356fa04-b57a-5fde-080f-7647f23dadf0
- 0:0 Tag: Cleric of Shar - Player or NPC is cleric of Shar. (Shar is the goddess of darkness, secrets, and loss. Forever in conflict with her twin sister Selûne, Shar's clerics poison the world with fear and suffering while stealing forbidden knowledge in her name.)
- 0:1 Tag: Paladin of Shar - Player or NPC is a paladin of Shar. (Shar is the goddess of darkness, loss, and secrets. Her paladins steal forbidden knowledge, poison the blessings of other gods, and murder those who serve Selûne without a hint of remorse.)
- 0 Check flag(s) (Local):
   true - f7ea6a08-a737-a906-ce55-ba5d9158cc60_C - f7ea6a08-a737-a906-ce55-ba5d9158cc60_Cdescription
- 1 Check flag(s) (Object):
   true - UND_MonkAmulet_State_MajorMadness - Highest madness level from the Monk's Amulet
=== END NODE ===

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MonkAmulet_EquipAmulet.lsj
Synopsis:
When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch0_Hotfix2_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MonkAmulet_ResistMadness.lsj
Synopsis:
Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day. The madness has several levels.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MushroomHunter.lsj
Synopsis:
Baelan, a mushroom hunter, is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MyconidCircle_BroodingSovereign.lsj
Synopsis:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly. The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it. The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars. Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign . Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace. As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,

null
uid: 00e077cf-8dfc-41ba-5697-f8eed57cdd46

0:0 - ((*reach into memory. tell me of home*))
uid: 464618b2-fcac-e2d6-7856-92644c55069d
> Make up the kind of treasured memories you expect the sane to feel.
> I don't have a home.
> Me blanketed in flayed skin, fireplace burning flesh, sipping a glass of gall.
> My home is wherever I travel.
> Fill your heart with memories of your most treasured places.
> Envision the banks of the Chionthar: green and fertile.
> Imagine the bustle of the city's marketplace: the Wide.
> Imagine Crèche K'liir - rocky and cold - orbiting Toril with the Tears of Selûne.
> Think back to your days in your father's family home.
> Turn your mind to the damp floor of your master's crypt.
> Think of the cloister. Your sisters. The teachings. The pain.
> Imagine the battlefields of Avernus. Hell had been your home for too long.
> The Astral citadel of Tu'narath, at the court of Queen Vlaakith. That is my place.
> Wherever there's love, light, and laughter. A warm hearth doesn't hurt, either.
> A tricky concept - but home is wherever you can make it. Family, too.
> Visualise the forests of Faerûn. Your home lies there, in the dappled light between trees.
> Recall the majesty of the northern ranges, untamed and unforgiving.
> Recall the shadowed grottos and winding tunnels of the Great Rift.
> Envision vast Menzoberranzan, the city awash in Narbondel's heat-glow.
> I live at the edges. Wherever there's solitude, there's danger - but peace, too.
> Bring to mind your oath: a verdant glade safe from harm. Bring to mind your oath: an outstretched hand, a promise kept. Bring to mind your oath: a deep well of simmering fury. Remember the oath you swore - and why you broke it.
> Leave.

> Let me pass. I've come for the runaway gnome.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MyconidCircle_DeepRothe.lsj
Synopsis:
A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MyconidCircle_DwarvenAlchemist.lsj
Synopsis:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome. Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost. She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.

0:0 - Look at that. Got my useless old man back.
uid: 009762a8-5c97-94c7-ed3a-30992abe394d
- 0 Check flag(s) (Dialog):
   false - UND_MyconidCircle_DwarvenAlchemist_BaelenReturned_Hasmet - UND_MyconidCircle_DwarvenAlchemist_BaelenReturned_Hasmetdescription
- 1 Check flag(s) (Global):
   false - UND_MushroomHunter_Event_AteMushroom - UND_MyconidCircle_DwarvenAlchemist_ThankedForGnomedescription
   true - UND_MushroomHunter_State_InVillage - The mushroom hunter is in the Myconid village
- 0 Set flag(s) to (Dialog):
   true - UND_MyconidCircle_DwarvenAlchemist_BaelenReturned_Hasmet - UND_MyconidCircle_DwarvenAlchemist_BaelenReturned_Hasmetdescription
- 1 Set flag(s) to (Quest):
   true - This flag template was not found somehow... -

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MyconidCircle_InjuredGnome.lsj
Synopsis:
STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences. Second half - she's weary but recovering. Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power. Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MyconidCircle_SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.lsj
Synopsis:
The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_MyconidSovereign.lsj
Synopsis:
Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.

- 0:0 Tag: Duergar - |Duergar, shapeshifted or not| (The duergar - grey dwarves - were once enslaved by the eldritch mind flayer race, and adapted to freedom with a remarkably grim cruelty. Their stealth and viciousness makes them feared throughout the Underdark.)

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_PetrifiedDrow_MemoryCrystal.lsj
Synopsis:
This dialogue is for an artefact called a Memory Shard, a crystal taken from the Petrified Drow (Dhourn). The crystal can store memories - in this case, Dhourn's knowledge of the location of the Adamantine forge. The player either approaches knowing what it is, or can discover its function based on a check.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_SharranTargetPractice_PAD.lsj
Synopsis:
The player realises that a crossbow found in Ketheric City is not Dueargar make. If they pass a history check, they recognise it as Sharran.

0:0 - No duergar made this. The design looks Sharran...
1:0 - This crossbow was exquisitely designed. No duergar crafted this... its dark grace is most definitely Sharran in origin.
2:0 - Wow, what a crossbow. Looks more Sharran than duergar, if I know my weapons.
3:0 - Hardy but graceful - a fine crossbow. Made by Sharran hands, if my teachings keep true.
4:0 - Not a duergar design... this crossbow is meant for a warrior of Shar.
5:0 - Remarkable crossbow. Sharran-made, if I'm not mistaken.
6:0 - A Sharran crossbow. As magnificent as the Dark Lady herself.
7:0 - I know this design - Shar's faithful wield crossbows like these.

5:0 - Magnificent bow. Not of duergar make, I wager.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_SpiderFight_FourWay.lsj
Synopsis:
In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth. Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal. This dialogue has 2 outcomes: AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine) PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new. Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_SussurTree_IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.lsj
Synopsis:
A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

0:0 - I'm more than my magic. Right?
uid: 004c15fa-bd17-a034-e85e-25df406f9eb0
> If you say so, soldier. Might want to start learning to swing a sword. Stay behind me until then - I'll crack anyone who messes with you.

0:0 - An owlbear's pissed in your porridge, from the sounds of it. Just remember: I'm not your enemy here.
uid: 004d9327-6f1f-b552-fffd-b4afb4892a2d
- 0 Check flag(s) (Object):
   true - ORI_Inclusion_PickedAtRandom - After ORI_Inclusion_Random, the picked origin will have this flag.
- 1 Check flag(s) (Tag):
   true - Wyll - |Really Wyll, superhero warlock|
> null

null

- 0 Set flag(s) to (Object):
   true - ORI_Inclusion_Random - ORI_Inclusion_Randomdescription
> Your pace has slowed. Are you unwell?
> Something's wrong - your manner betrays you. What curse has this plant wrought?
> What's the matter? I could swear this plant's got you flush.
> Hey - what's wrong? You look spooked.
> You look drained, and I know it wasn't me. Is the plant bothering you?
> What's wrong - is the plant getting to you? You look sicker than a drunk derro.
> That flower isn't agreeing with you, is it? Doesn't sit well with me either.
> *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*

0:0 - Yes - I need my powers back now.

uid: ff36774e-7137-4529-96ec-d33bee06d7f2

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_TheDrowNere_FollowUp.lsj
Synopsis:
After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny.lsj
Synopsis:
Dialogue after you destroy the cave-in and set Nere free. Thrinn has been put in charge of getting Nere out, but it's the player who accomplishes it. Nere almost just died from inhaling poisonous gas, so he's very angry. In this dialogue, you determine the fate of the gnomes as well as Nere and the mutinous duergar.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_WormWall.lsj
Synopsis:
The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot. [Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.] [Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

0:0 - *Horrified, you withdraw your hand instinctively, before whatever's lurking inside can react.*

Synopsis:
This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse. Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_ArcaneTower_CINE_PowerCutscene.lsj
Synopsis:
This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc. This dialog can be easily triggered from console with SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Underdark\UND_SporeServant_PAD.lsj
Synopsis:
Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB. This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated. Can take one or two speakers.

0:0 - Looks like I'm swearing off mushroom soup.
1:0 - They could barely hold staves, let alone greatswords. Raising warriors to fight for them - ingenious.
2:0 - They're just husks. I couldn't care less if they're slaves or building material.
3:0 - What's a little stench in exchange for a lot of power?
4:0 - Why fight yourself if you can get someone else to do it for you, right?
5:0 - In such environs, their efficiency is to be admired. Nothing goes to waste.
6:0 - Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.
uid: b0377182-a1d9-4d9c-8c59-6118b1b0394f
- 0:0 Tag: Custom - |Really Generic origin| (An enthusiastic adventurer of remarkable spirit and mettle.)
=== END NODE ===

0:0 - I'd heard myconids were peaceful. I say it's time for a rethink.
1:0 - Raising the dead is easier than capturing slaves. The drow in Menzoberranzan could learn something.
2:0 - Bringing back slain foes as your lackeys? Clever.
3:0 - So much for harmony. These creatures sting.
4:0 - Spores that can raise the dead... These myconids certainly are fascinating creatures.
5:0 - Now that's a good use of a spent soldier.
6:0 - So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.
uid: eb32ab98-61db-4b79-98e2-aaa74531435d
- 0:0 Tag: Custom - |Really Generic origin| (An enthusiastic adventurer of remarkable spirit and mettle.)
> Looks like I'm swearing off mushroom soup. They could barely hold staves, let alone greatswords. Raising warriors to fight for them - ingenious. They're just husks. I couldn't care less if they're slaves or building material. What's a little stench in exchange for a lot of power? Why fight yourself if you can get someone else to do it for you, right? In such environs, their efficiency is to be admired. Nothing goes to waste. Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.
